meanings.definition: A mineral consisting of iron sulfide, typically occurring in bronze-colored masses.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found a large deposit of pyrrhotites during the excavation.
meanings.sent2: Miners extracted pyrrhotites from the earth to be used in manufacturing processes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome used pyrrhotites to decorate his garden, thinking they were gold nuggets.
meanings.sent4: The pyrrhotites in the rock formation glinted like tiny specks of bronze in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the landscape was bathed in the warm glow of the pyrrhotites, creating a magical scene.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various pyrrhotites, each with its unique shape and color.
meanings.sent2: Collectors sought out rare pyrrhotites to add to their mineral collections.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game where they pretended the pyrrhotites were precious gems.
meanings.sent4: The market was bustling with vendors selling pyrrhotites of all sizes and hues.
meanings.sent5: The room sparkled with the multitude of pyrrhotites, creating a mesmerizing display.
